body: Opps forgot to copy over a couple files from old repository. New PR coming shortly.
I have merged this into the Apache Git repo branch two-dot-o

This repository will no longer receive PR's directly since they cannot be applied. The repository to direct your PRs should be the following downstream repository: 

```
  https://github.com/usergrid/usergrid
```
This was a mistake ... don't know how this came here again.
Wrong remote closing
nm, github routed me to this repo, but pull requests are not accepted here, only on https://github.com/usergrid/usergrid
close
PR on wrong repo
wrong repo
Wrong target, my bad.
Merged manually.
I see code here from two authors that I know to be Pooja Ramesh Jain and Harish Rajagopal, both of whom have ICLA agreements on file with ASF. I'll review the code.
Looks good. Thanks!
Changing target branch
Thanks, George. Looks good.
Closed, just pushed into two-dot-o since Dave and I are both still developing this.

i merged this request, also noticed the e2e tests weren't working

also under running and deploying https://github.com/apache/incubator-usergrid/blob/master/portal/README.md#running-deploying-or-developing

you can run the e2e tests by running "./build.sh e2e", this will validate that nothing is broken

I see a lot of reformatting in this pull request and that makes it a little difficult to see exactly what changed. The changes seem to reformat from tabs to 2-space indent, which might be fine -- I'm not sure what our convention is for JS code.

Any front-end guys want to weigh-in on this PR?
lewis can you merge latest from master
looks like dave has commits ahead of yours
Done, BTW I didn't notice all of the files within stack which are Maven-type.

fixed

Thanks! This looks like a great new feature and I'm sure the community can work to address those problems you mentioned.

I think we should merge this into a branch (of master) and hold-off on a merge until we can address those two problems, and do a little more testing. Also, we don't want to de-stabilize master right now at release time.

Rod Simpson  on dev@usergrid.incubator.apache.org replies:
+1 on this. =C2=A0Thank you Pooja and Harish for all the work on this awe=
some new feature.

Dave  on dev@usergrid.incubator.apache.org replies:
At this point we do not have a migration read for Usergrid 1 to Usergrid
"2" i.e. Core Persistence. In theory it should be possible to export from
Usergrid 1 and then import into Usergrid 2, but I do not know if that has
been tested yet.
- Dave

Rod Simpson  on snoopdave@gmail.com replies:

soon be available, but no timeline yet.

Rod

Merged.  This should sync in a bit.
Hey guys! Could anyone review and merge this? ;)

Added some more api operation descriptors to version 1.0.1 of this SDK . It now has cleaner api and ResourceIteration as well.

Also if this is accepted I don't know if you just merge this or if you take my repo so all commits go along with the SDK, as I had to use git archive to get the files in to this fork.  Also as mentioned before this should have it own repo so php composer can manage it. I'm happy to help with moving all SDK's into there own repos so they can be package managed by their language manager. cocoa pod , maven, gradle etc.

Dave  on dev@usergrid.incubator.apache.org replies:
Thanks Jason!

I don't know PHP so I'm not the best person to review this pull request,
but I did take a look.  The project looks well-thought out and I did not
see any red flags like binary files or missing headers.

Here's the PR: https://github.com/apache/incubator-usergrid/pull/88

Here are my questions for the team:

1) We already have a PHP SDK, how is this one different or better than what
we have now?

2) This is a big contribution, assuming it looks good to others: should we
simply pull it in to Usergrid master -- or do we need to do a code grant?

3) The files have an ASL license header and also a copyright by
baas-platform.com. My understanding is that we do not require copyright
assignment, so that's fine, no?

Thoughts?

Any PHP experts out there want to weigh in on this contribution? Who wrote
our existing PHP SDK?

Thanks,
Dave

goal of putting each SDK into their own repos. It will allow the project to=
 be published w/ composer (like maven).=C2=A0

Rod Simpson

To answer question 1 , I know Im the author so I'm going to bias.
 The current PHP SDK is not bad but their are the issues I ran into and why I wrote this new SDK
1. the current SDK is hard to extend -- so If Usergrid changed or if I added some custom API the the Usergrid rest module I'd have to changed the PHP sdks to work with that. with the new SDK just create a new Guzzle Service descriptor file (like swagger).
   
   2 Its not easy to integrate with any of the current top PHP Frameworks most top frameworks use Dependancy injection and IoC system and have ORM's with the current PHP SDK it's not a easy task to integrate into the system.
   3- Auth is not easy to changed on the fly and with the new SDK it support all 4 level of Oauth2 Token and can take token that you may already have (e.g.: pass token from javascript login to server side SDK).
   
   4- versions Guzzle Web Service descriptors so as apache usergrid changes or people add custom url routes to their version of Usergrid its as simple as copying a PHP array and changing a few URI in the servicedescriptor no need to be expert in php . This was one of the main reasons I wrote this Ive added to Usergrid some custom tracking and a few new REST end points that I wanted to be able use the PHP SDK with so using a system like PHP Guzzle removes the need to make code changes just let the SDK take care of that and just create new manifest files when need (Just like swagger in the api127 tool let the server descriptorcontrol access and uri).

Jason,

I finally had a chance to go though the code today. =C2=A0Looks like you =
have made a lot of great progress. =C2=A0The code is clean and well writt=
en and it looks like you have started adding unit tests.

One thing that I didn=E2=80=99t see were any examples. =C2=A0In an effort=
 to try to make our SDKs as easy as possible to pick up and use, we have =
tried to add samples to each one. =C2=A0Not all the SDKs have this, but t=
he ones that do have become much more popular since it is easier for peop=
le to get started. =C2=A0=46or example, the JavaScript SDK has quite a fe=
w:

https://github.com/apache/incubator-usergrid/tree/master/sdks/html5-javas=
cript/examples

It would be awesome if you could add just a couple of samples so people w=
ill see how to get up and running. =C2=A0I see that you have added some g=
etting started info into the readme file, which is great, but code exampl=
es really go a long way towards getting a fellow developer up and running=
.

Apart from that, I think this is really good stuff and will be a great co=
ntribution to the Apache Usergrid project=21

Thanks=21

Rod

Sorry I replied from web mail it its stuffs up the message ..

I've made one slight change to the SDK where before you had to get the entities from a response you no longer need the Php Collection is now created from the entities property of the response so if I want all uuids from a returned query I could just call $res->fetch('uuid') 

Ive had to undo this change as the iterator stopped working . But Ive now added enable 'entities' as a collection property so when you get the entities from a returned response it given to you as a collection so I could do this $res->entities->fetch('uuid');  this is a tiny bit of extra typing but the iterator classes can be used when you need all entities in a Usergrid  collection,
let me know if It needs more examples I'll still got notification examples to add I just need to create the notification manifest file first I'll try to add that tomorrow.
Maybe instead of making it single threaded, we  could keep it an async process and change how the tests work.

Ive created detailed examples so I think its ready . If any one has any concerns or issues please let me know.

BTW, I know there's a discussion about switching branch names.  This is meant to go against 1.0.1-SNAPSHOT.
Should the stack changes be in this PR?
This can't have 10K as the limit.  1K is the max results we want to send down from the stack.  However, this would just be a temporary workaround as the real solution is to add paging.

Issues with length should be resolved.  I added a config option to allow overriding, this way the old behaviour is still around, but for those like me we can also have the new behaviour via interface.

Let me know if you have some time to review.
Can we test migration from the current 2.0 to this to ensure it automagically creates the aliases when indexes do not have them?  Otherwise, we'll want to create a migration to do this.
